etymologies: mid 16th century (originally denoting the corn marigold): from Latin, from Greek khrusanthemon, from khrusos ‘gold’ + anthemon ‘flower’

definitions: a plant of the daisy family with brightly colored ornamental flowers, existing in many cultivated varieties.

notes.text: Genera Chrysanthemum or (most cultivated species) Dendranthema, family Compositae

shortDefinitions: plant of daisy family with brightly coloured ornamental flowers, existing in many cultivated varieties
